member.name: T:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyDiscoverer
member.summary: xUnit2 test case discoverer to link the method with the PropertyAttribute to the PropertyTestCase so the test can be run via FsCheck.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyTestCase
member.summary: The xUnit2 test runner for the PropertyAttribute that executes the test via FsCheck

member.name: T:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertiesAttribute
member.summary: Set common configuration for all properties within this class or module

member.name: P:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyAttribute.Verbose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Output all generated arguments.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyAttribute.StartSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: The size to use for the first test.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyAttribute.Replay(System.String)
member.summary: If set, the seed to use to start testing. Allows reproduction of previous runs. You can just paste the tuple from the output window, e.g. 12344,12312 or (123,123).

member.name: P:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyAttribute.QuietOnSuccess(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set, suppresses the output from the test if the test is successful. This can be useful when running tests with TestDriven.net, because TestDriven.net pops up the Output window in Visual Studio if a test fails; thus, when conditioned to that behaviour, it's always a bit jarring to receive output from passing tests. The default is false, which means that FsCheck will also output test results on success, but if set to true, FsCheck will suppress output in the case of a passing test. This setting doesn't affect the behaviour in case of test failures.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyAttribute.MaxTest(System.Int32)
member.summary: The maximum number of tests that are run.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyAttribute.MaxFail(System.Int32)
member.summary: The maximum number of tests where values are rejected, e.g. as the result of ==>

member.name: P:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyAttribute.EndSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: The size to use for the last test, when all the tests are passing. The size increases linearly between Start- and EndSize.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyAttribute.Arbitrary(System.Type[])
member.summary: The Arbitrary instances to use for this test method. The Arbitrary instances are merged in back to front order i.e. instances for the same generated type at the front of the array will override those at the back.

member.summary: Output all generated arguments.

member.summary: The size to use for the first test.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Xunit.PropertyAttribute
member.summary: Run this method as an FsCheck test.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Xunit.ArbitraryAttribute
member.summary: Override Arbitrary instances for FsCheck tests within the attributed class or module.
